Name: Slithering
Effect: You are always prone. You no longer move more slowly while prone, and no longer have disadvantage on melee attacks while prone.

Name: Camoflage
Effect: If you have not taken a movement action since the start of your last turn, you have advantage on Stealth skill checks and your current tile is considered a hiding spot.

Name: Brawny
Effect: You have advantage on Shove attacks.

Name: Scrawny
Effect: Shove and Grapple attacks against you have disadvantage.

Name: Sensory Enhancement
Effect: You have advantage on skill checks made as part of the Spot and Scan actions.

Name: Horned
Effect: Whenever you move 2 or more tiles in a straight line, you may make a melee Shove attack against a creature that is in front of you without spending any AP.

Name: Hybrid Vigor
Effect: Gain one of the other Awakened subspecies' combat features.

Name: Tough Skin
Effect: At the start of each of your turns, gain 2 absorption.

Name: Glider
Effect: For tier of height lost while falling, you may move into an adjacent tile. You no longer take falling damage.

Name: Momentum
Effect: At the end of each of your turns, if you moved this turn you must move 1 tile in the direction you last moved in if able.

Name: Trample
Effect: Whenever you move through the tile of a prone creature, deal 1d4 + Prowess physical damage to them.

Name: Lumbering
Effect: You can only take at most one movement action each turn. Whenever you take a movement action, make a Prowess attack against all creatures in a 1 tile radius. If you hit, knock them prone.

Name: Cornered Animal
Effect: You have advantage on all attacks while there are no empty adjacent tiles.  Empty adjacent tiles that you are seperated from by an abrupt edge do not count.

Name: Teamwork
Effect: You may make an attack of opportunity against an enemy in your zone of control whenever they are hit by an attack.

Name: Surefooted
Effect: Ignore the effects of difficult terrain.

Name: Tiny
Effect: You do not need a hiding spot to Hide or stay hidden.

Name: Stampede
Effect: At the end of each of your turns, if you have at least one stack of frightened apply two stacks of frightened to each adjacent creature.

Name: Massive
Effect: Prowess attacks made against you have disadvantage.

Name: Thick Shell
Effect: While you have absorption, whenever you would gain an ailment, gain one fewer stack of that ailment.

Name: Tenacious
Effect: You are immune to damage from afflictions that would reduce you to 0 life or less.

Name: High Flying
Effect: While flying, attacks against you which could apply rooted, grappled or knock you prone have disadvantage.

Name: Menacing
Effect: At the end of each of your turns, apply one stack of frightened to each adjacent creature.

Name: Meek
Effect: Whenever a creature would target you with a single target attack, make a Focus attack against them. If you hit, they must target a different creature with that attack instead, or lose any costs spent on that action.

Name: Adorable
Effect: After you lose life due to an offensive action, apply one stack of pacified to the creature that caused you to lose life.

Name: Poisonous
Effect: Whenever you're hit by a melee attack or at the end of each of your turns while you are grappled, apply two stacks of the specified affliction to the creature that hit you.

Name: Intimidation
Effect: 1 AP: make a Presence attack against a creature within a 6 tile range. If you hit, apply two stacks of frightened.
